metadata.synopsis: Default Ravengard dialogue. Depending on the path, Ravengard may urge you to save the city, and if Wyll is in party, will offer the quest to go to the Wyrmway. Wyll's endgame state is detremined here: He may become a Duke, the Blade of Avernus, or remain the Blade of Frontiers
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to ravengard once you recruit him in camp.

522.speaker: Player
522.text: It isn't what you think. It never was.
522.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Father, please - there's something I must show you.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as Wyll's memories flow into him.*
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

515.speaker: Player
515.text: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

551.speaker: Player
551.text: Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. It is clear: we awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *Your mind intertwines with Ravengard's, then disentangles.*
32.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

138.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
138.text: This place is touched by the infernal. I can smell the she-devil. I can smell my son.
138.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

309.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
309.text: Bring him here. We can talk after.

33.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
33.text: The devil's stench lingers. But Wyll is yet a champion of the people. I had hoped he'd join me on the Council, but - he is his own man. I couldn't be prouder.
33.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

35.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
35.text: I had hoped Wyll would join me on the Council - but the Blade's spirit is indomitable. He is destined for greatness.
35.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

45.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
45.text: We must act. I know a way to purge the Absolute from the city.
45.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

56.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
56.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

75.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
75.text: I had hoped Wyll would join me on the Council - but the Blade's spirit is indomitable. He is destined for greatness.
75.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *Wyll's tadpole resonates with Ravengard's. The exhausted Grand Duke is a flurry of emotion - gratitude and relief, anger and deep pain.*
77.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

80.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
80.text: I have faith in Wyll. He is a conqueror - as are you.
80.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *Your tadpole resonates with your father's. The exhausted Grand Duke is a flurry of emotion - gratitude and relief, anger and deep pain.*
91.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

95.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
95.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

103.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
103.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

125.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
125.text: The devil's stench lingers, my son. But you are yet a champion of the people. I had hoped you'd join me on the Council, but - you are your own man. I couldn't be prouder.
125.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: I will blaze a path before me and behind me. Justice will prevail in the Sword Coast.

460.speaker: Player
460.text: I pulled you from death's grip, and this is how you thank me?
460.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

520.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
520.text: You want my gratitude? Fine - take your fill. But I will not celebrate this infernal resurrection.
520.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: It isn't what you think, father. It never was.
161.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

584.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
584.text: It is exactly what I think.
584.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

583.speaker: Player
583.text: I was forbidden to tell you before. But now, I can tell you the truth.
583.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

331.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
331.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

463.speaker: Player
463.text: Gods, this is just like you to judge without knowing the whole story.
463.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

213.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
213.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

355.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
355.text: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
355.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *Your head tingles. Memories flow through your mind, seeking escape.*
1.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I sacrificed my soul to save yours. I had no choice.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: I've devoted my life to using my power to keep the Sword Coast safe.
240.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

389.speaker: Player
389.text: Connect with your father's mind. It's time he knew the truth.
389.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *Your father's tadpole clenches as your memories flow into him.*
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

512.text: *Ravengard sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in your face as an impossible choice is set before you.*

540.speaker: Narrator
540.text: *Ravengard sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in your face as an impossible choice is set before you.*

377.speaker: Narrator
377.text: *The past becomes present. Your father sees you partner with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*

38.text: Wyll - my son. I'm so sorry. I didn't know.

428.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
428.text: Wyll - my son. I'm so sorry. I didn't know.

502.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
502.text: You sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: There's nothing to forgive. You only wanted to protect the city.

572.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
572.text: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -

107.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
107.text: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I am the Hells' nemesis, the Blade of Avernus!

517.speaker: Player
517.text: Ansur was a myth, father. It is up to me to save Baldur's Gate from the Absolute.

406.speaker: Player
406.text: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I've pledged to follow in your footsteps!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Ansur was a myth, father. I will be the one to defeat the Absolute - and the city will hail me as a Grand Duke.

429.speaker: Player
429.text: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I am the Heart of the Gate, the Blade of Frontiers!

297.speaker: Player
297.text: Ansur was a myth, father. It is up to me to save Baldur's Gate from the Absolute.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

295.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
295.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. The ones I made you recite every morning. The ones you'll call on in the days to come.

356.speaker: Player
356.text: Tell your father about the battle with Ansur.

241.speaker: Narrator
241.text: *Uncertainty fills the air. You have reached a fork in your path. In which direction will you travel?*

499.speaker: Player
499.text: Will the people even accept me as duke? I mean, look at me.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I am no aristocrat. Call me the Blade of Avernus, hunter of fiends and foul beasts.

360.speaker: Narrator
360.text: *Beneath your monstrous skin lives a hero. Some people may fear you, but to protect the Sword Coast is your calling. You cannot turn your back.*

174.speaker: Player
174.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

26.speaker: Player
26.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

121.speaker: Player
121.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

301.speaker: Player
301.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

367.speaker: Player
367.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

544.speaker: Narrator
544.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

501.speaker: Player
501.text: The Blade of Frontiers is dead. I will be Wyll Ravengard, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.

324.speaker: Narrator
324.text: *Baldur's Gate is your home, and you are its servant, relentless in your pursuit of the greatest good. You would sooner die by Mizora's hand than endanger the city.*

550.speaker: Player
550.text: *Your father's courage is an inspiration. You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

531.speaker: Player
531.text: *Your father's courage is an inspiration. You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

500.speaker: Player
500.text: *Your father's courage is an inspiration. You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

395.speaker: Player
395.text: *Your father's courage is an inspiration. You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

65.speaker: Player
65.text: *Your father's courage is an inspiration. You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

424.speaker: Narrator
424.text: *Your father's courage is an inspiration. You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

233.speaker: Player
233.text: What makes you so sure the people will welcome me as a duke?

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I am no aristocrat. I am the Blade of Frontiers, eternal protector of the Sword Coast.

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *When evil's shadow darkened the Sword Coast, you brought your light. You are the people's protector. To fell monsters and guard the meek is your calling.*

57.speaker: Player
57.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Frontiers. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

427.speaker: Player
427.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Frontiers. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

237.speaker: Player
237.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Frontiers. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

153.speaker: Player
153.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Frontiers. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

284.speaker: Narrator
284.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Frontiers. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

123.speaker: Player
123.text: The Blade of Frontiers is dead. I will be Wyll Ravengard, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.

302.speaker: Narrator
302.text: *Baldur's Gate is your home, and you are its servant, relentless in your pursuit of the greatest good.*

483.speaker: Player
483.text: Wouldn't you rather wake the dragon yourself?

456.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
456.text: You showed me that you are the future of Baldur's Gate - and well beyond it.

486.speaker: Player
486.text: I'll seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

384.speaker: Player
384.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

298.speaker: Player
298.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

564.speaker: Player
564.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I can forgive you. But I can never forget.

134.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
134.text: Nor should you. The self is the sum of its experiences. You are the man you are because of them.

70.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
70.text: Then I pray that time mends the rift between us.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You exiled me from my own home. I can't forgive you.

61.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
61.text: I understand. I'm not sure I can forgive myself.

266.speaker: Player
266.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

337.speaker: Narrator
337.text: *There is no stopping it: the truth bubbles over, flooding first your mind, then your father's.*
337.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard and Wyll touch their own heads.

159.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
159.text: I know you will accomplish great deeds. So must we all.
159.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

170.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
170.text: First you cleave my heart in twain. Now you shatter it into pieces.
170.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

167.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
167.text: My son a monster, twisted almost beyond recognition. To think my blood flows through those veins.
167.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

114.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
114.text: Is this my fate - to rise from death into a hell of my own boy's making?
114.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

198.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
198.text: Is this my fate - to be freed from Gortash's hell only to be trapped in yours?
198.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

568.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
568.text: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to rise from death into a hell of my own boy's making?
568.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

60.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
60.text: My own son, still the she-devil's toy. Is this my fate - to be freed from Gortash's hell only to be trapped in yours?
60.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: It isn't what you think. It never was.
6.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

186.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
186.text: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
186.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

474.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
474.text: It is exactly what I think.
474.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

375.speaker: Player
375.text: Wyll pulled you from death's grip, and this is how you thank him?
375.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

151.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
151.text: You want my gratitude? Fine - take your fill. But I will not celebrate this infernal resurrection.

556.speaker: Wyll
556.text: Father, please - there's something I must show you.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Your son sacrificed his soul to save yours. He had no choice.
197.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

559.speaker: Player
559.text: Wyll's devoted his life to protecting the Coast. He's used his power wisely.
559.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

267.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
267.text: There is no wise use of the Hells' powers.
267.context: NodeContext: A bit of hurt, a bit of anger, but always composed.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: I'm beginning to think we should have let you drown.
221.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard, Wyll, and players touch their own heads.

354.speaker: Wyll
354.text: No, please. Father - let me show you.
354.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard, Wyll, and players touch their own heads.

528.speaker: Narrator
528.text: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
528.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld. Ravengard, Wyll, and players touch their own heads.

450.text: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
450.context: NodeContext: Beginning to see the truth. Your son became a devil to save your life.

254.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
254.text: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
254.context: NodeContext: Beginning to see the truth. Your son became a devil to save your life.

347.speaker: Narrator
347.text: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
347.context: NodeContext: Beginning to see the truth. Your son became a devil to save your life.

482.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
482.context: NodeContext: Beginning to see the truth. Your son became a devil to save your life.

570.speaker: Narrator
570.text: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
570.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mind meld ends after the node is over.

542.speaker: Narrator
542.text: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
542.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mind meld ends after the node is over.

316.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

216.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
216.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

537.speaker: Wyll
537.text: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: It's the truth, Ravengard. Wyll has always been a faithful defender of Baldur's Gate.
175.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

41.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
41.text: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
41.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

117.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
117.text: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
117.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

259.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
259.text: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
259.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

404.speaker: Wyll
404.text: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.

379.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
379.text: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -

543.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
543.text: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.

437.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
437.text: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.

533.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
533.text: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.

106.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
106.text: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.

253.speaker: Wyll
253.text: Do you mean Ansur? The wyrm is dead, father. Where we might have once found a friend, we found only his bones, animated by an old grievance.

446.speaker: Wyll
446.text: But the Heart of the Gate still lives - in me, in my allies.

416.speaker: Wyll
416.text: In Ansur's defeat, I've found my spirit renewed. For as long as the Sword Coast needs a champion, I've vowed to answer its call.

444.speaker: Wyll
444.text: I am the Blade of Frontiers!

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: In Ansur's defeat, I've found my spirit renewed. For as long as devils and demons imperil the Sword Coast, they will by my prey.

378.speaker: Wyll
378.text: I am the Blade of Avernus!

534.speaker: Wyll
534.text: In Ansur's defeat, I've found my spirit renewed. Once I've vanquished the Absolute, I will walk in your footsteps and lead the city as a Grand Duke.

553.speaker: Wyll
553.text: I am Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder!

278.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
278.text: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

71.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
71.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

432.speaker: Wyll
432.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. I remember them well. You made me recite them every morning.

30.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
30.text: So you do. And I thought you'd abandoned them, more fool me.

471.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
471.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

222.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
222.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

293.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
293.text: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.

162.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
162.text: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.

433.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
433.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

423.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
423.text: Let it set the path before you.

523.speaker: Player
523.text: Tell Ravengard about the battle with Ansur.

381.speaker: Wyll
381.text: I failed, father. The wyrm is fallen.

380.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
380.text: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.

280.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
280.text: You and your allies slayed the undead terror that was once the great Ansur. You are stronger than even the great wyrm.

242.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
242.text: You will be the one to part the storms and lead the people through. You, not Ansur, are the saviour we need.

338.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
338.text: First, you will fell the Absolute. Then, we will rebuild Baldur's Gate, we will take back our city - together.

352.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
352.text: I will name you Baldur's Gate's newest Grand Duke of the Council. You will be hailed Heart of the Gate.

332.speaker: Wyll
332.text: Grand Duke? I look the part of a fiend. A half-devil possesses my very soul.

326.speaker: Wyll
326.text: Grand Duke? I look the part of a fiend.

425.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
425.text: I will tell the citizens and the patriars of your good works. They will know you carry your father's banner.

101.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
101.text: But it is true - you are still under the she-devil's thumb...

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Uncertainty fills the air. Wyll has reached a fork in his path. In which direction will he travel?*
73.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You are a hero, not an aristocrat. The Blade is a champion. 'Duke Wyll Ravengard' is not.
29.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: I fought to right the wrongs of the Coast, to slay the men and monsters that hunt the helpless.
19.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

244.speaker: Wyll
244.text: It is in the wilds that I find my courage, not in the halls of Upper City estates.
244.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

247.speaker: Wyll
247.text: There will be no Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard. And there will be no Blade of Frontiers.
247.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

526.speaker: Wyll
526.text: I am now the Blade of Avernus.
526.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

339.speaker: Wyll
339.text: For as long as demons and devils imperil the Sword Coast, they will be my prey.
339.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

532.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
532.text: Then go with my blessing. Be Faerûn's great defender.

459.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
459.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. Let these be the lights that guide you, my son. Hail the Blade of Avernus!

42.speaker: Player
42.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Avernus at your side, you know you can triumph.*

179.speaker: Narrator
179.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Avernus at your side, you know you can triumph.*

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Wyll, Mizora could be a dangerous influence. You can't accept your father's offer.

439.speaker: Wyll
439.text: They're right and we both know it. No manner of duke should be tied to a devil's leash.
439.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

412.speaker: Wyll
412.text: No manner of duke should save a city, only to open a gate to the Hells.
412.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Become a Grand Duke. Imagine the power you'll wield.
142.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

336.speaker: Wyll
336.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons my father taught me.
336.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

201.speaker: Wyll
201.text: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good.
201.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

219.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
219.text: I would sooner die by Mizora's hand than let her endanger the city. I'll figure out a way.
219.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

565.speaker: Wyll
565.text: The Blade of Frontiers is no more. I will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
565.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

373.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
373.text: My son! Together, there is no army we cannot conquer and no wrong we cannot right.

286.speaker: Player
286.text: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

133.speaker: Player
133.text: A Grand Duke? You can't turn down an offer like that. Think of the power you'll wield.

488.speaker: Player
488.text: I trust you, Wyll. Follow your heart, wherever it leads.

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: Grand Duke? My soul lies with the city. But...
132.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

58.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
58.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

467.speaker: Wyll
467.text: I have slain monsters, faced illithids, guarded the helpless. To be a duke - is this the destiny I've awaited? Is the nobility my calling?
467.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

575.speaker: Player
575.text: You are a hero, not an aristocrat. The Blade is a champion. 'Duke Wyll Ravengard' is not.

400.speaker: Player
400.text: Wyll, Mizora could be a dangerous influence. You can't accept your father's offer.

13.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
13.text: There will be no Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.

563.speaker: Wyll
563.text: I am the defender of the weak, I am the stalker of devils -

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: I am the Blade of Frontiers!

353.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
353.text: My boy, my blood. Let it be known: the Blade is on the hunt. Feel his sting!

43.speaker: Player
43.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Frontiers at your side, you know you can triumph.*

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Frontiers at your side, you know you can triumph.*

405.speaker: Player
405.text: Become a Grand Duke. Think of the good you could do.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: A Grand Duke? You can't turn down an offer like that. Think of the power you'll yield.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I trust you, Wyll. Follow your heart, wherever it leads.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: Wouldn't you rather wake the dragon yourself?

100.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
100.text: The legend has it that Ansur will only answer to a proven hero of the city. Until a moment ago, I thought that was me.

155.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
155.text: But is he who rejects his own child a hero? What of he who calls his brave son a monster?

391.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
391.text: You showed me the truth. You showed me that I was the one who turned his back.

273.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
273.text: You showed me that Wyll may be the future of Baldur's Gate - and well beyond it.

506.speaker: Player
506.text: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

385.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
385.text: And may the city know the truth of my only son. Pride of Ravengard, pride of Baldur's Gate.

334.speaker: Player
334.text: Wyll? What do you make of this?

496.speaker: Wyll
496.text: Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. My father was clear: we awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.

362.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
362.text: Wyll - you are more valorous than Balduran himself.

102.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
102.text: May the city know the truth of my only son. Pride of Ravengard, pride of Baldur's Gate.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

392.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
392.text: A history told by Balduran himself, passed from Grand Duke to Grand Duke, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

370.speaker: Player
370.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

141.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
141.text: A great warrior knows when to contain the storm and when to release it.

581.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
581.text: Today, you've earned my trust. I know you will do right by me when the time comes.

305.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
305.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

549.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
549.text: I once held a copy, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.

372.speaker: Player
372.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

386.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
386.text: As you say - but not too much later. I know a way to defeat the Absolute. And it lurks in the darkness below the city's streets.

478.speaker: Player
478.text: It's time you two made up. We've got a city to save.
478.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

265.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
265.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Heh. I bet you feel like a real bastard right about now.
292.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

365.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
365.context: NodeContext: Quietly. Moved to see the truth of your son's sacrifice.

390.speaker: Player
390.text: Call on the parasite, connect with father and son. Ravengard should know the truth.

187.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
187.text: You must awaken Ansur beneath the city, Wyll. Our future depends on it.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: I will see it done, father. You have my word.

192.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
192.text: My son, I have heard of Ansur's fate.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I've pledged to follow in your footsteps, for the good of the Gate.

318.speaker: Player
318.text: Ansur was a pile of bones. I will defeat the Absolute on my own terms, and become a Grand Duke.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I am the Hells' nemesis, the Blade of Avernus!

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Ansur was a pile of bones. It's up to us to save the city from the Absolute's wrath.

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Your father waits expectantly. It is time he knows your chosen path.*

214.speaker: Player
214.text: The wyrm is dead, but his spirit lives within me. I am the Heart of the Gate, the Blade of Frontiers!

288.speaker: Player
288.text: Ansur was a pile of bones. It's up to us to save the city from the Absolute's wrath.

245.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
245.text: Bring your leader to me, Wyll. I want to speak to both of you.

258.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
258.text: The devil's stench lingers. But Wyll is yet a champion of the people. I had hoped he'd join me on the Council, but - he is his own man. I couldn't be prouder.

261.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
261.text: Bring Wyll to me. I want to hear more about Ansur.

205.speaker: Wyll
205.text: The wyrm is dead, father. Where we might have once found a friend, we found only his bones, animated by an old grievance.

321.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
321.text: The Absolute's voice is gone, but I still hear its echoes - reflections of reflections.

322.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
322.text: Bring Wyll to me. I need to speak with him.

350.speaker: Narrator
350.text: *Your tadpole resonates with Ravengard's. The exhausted Grand Duke is a flurry of emotion - gratitude and relief, anger and deep pain.*

546.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
546.text: W-Wyll? It - it can't be. By Balduran's graces, have you fallen so far that Avernus has taken you?

440.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
440.text: Together, Wyll and I will make Baldur's Gate the brightest gem aside the Sword Sea. The Heart of the Gate will prevail.

451.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
451.text: I had hoped you'd join me on the Council - but the Blade's spirit is indomitable. You are destined for greatness.

466.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
466.text: Together, Wyll and I will make Baldur's Gate the brightest gem aside the Sword Sea. The Heart of the Gate will prevail.

469.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
469.text: Together, we will make Baldur's Gate the brightest gem aside the Sword Sea. The Heart of the Gate will prevail.

519.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
519.text: Go. You must awaken the wyrm.

314.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
314.text: Can it be? Bring your leader to me. I would speak to you both.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *The world spins as Ravengard's dizziness flows into you.*
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small mind meld just for this one node.

260.text: His mind is his own, but the elder brain touched him deeper than most. He must stay here - he will need time to recover.
260.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

328.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
328.text: The voice is gone, but I still hear its echoes - reflections of reflections.
328.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

119.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
119.text: Godsdamned Gortash - he'll suffer for this. I'll drive Balduran's sword straight through his belly.
119.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Gortash is done for. It was a long time coming.
203.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Gortash is done for. It was not a pleasant end for him.
72.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

24.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
24.text: So the bastard's gone? A shame I never... ngh...
24.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

190.speaker: Narrator
190.text: *Your parasites link. Pain splits your head, and you hear a distant voice, a whisper of a memory. It calls for you. All of you...*
190.context: CinematicNodeContext: His hand flies to Ravengard's head, then he lowers it.

227.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
227.text: I saw your mind. That thing's still in me - and there's one in you. I don't understand.
227.context: CinematicNodeContext: His hand flies to Ravengard's head, then he lowers it.

276.text: Relax your mind. I will show him.
276.context: CinematicNodeContext: His hand flies to Ravengard's head, then he lowers it.

518.speaker: Player
518.text: Let the Emperor reveal your memories.
518.context: CinematicNodeContext: His hand flies to Ravengard's head, then he lowers it.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *Ravengard gasps as his thoughts consume yours. He sees everything - the nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*

289.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
289.text: By the Hells, my life hinges on a mind flayer's whim, and Baldur's Gate hangs from its talons.

218.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
218.text: It seems the fate of the city lies in your hands.

511.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
511.text: Please - promise that you'll be the shield that defends, the sword that slays, and the hammer that rebuilds. Be our champion.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I will defeat the Absolute and defend this great city. You have my word.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: Tell him about your battle with Ansur.

300.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
300.text: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.

548.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
548.text: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.

169.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
169.text: A terrible fate for Ansur, my son. Yet my hopes for the city's future have never been higher.

184.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
184.text: Ansur is dead? By the living gods.

55.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
55.text: Bring me my son. I must speak with him.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Florrick is free. She's gathering allies as we speak.

196.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
196.text: Tremendous news. She proves as loyal to you as she is to me.

212.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
212.text: I couldn't bear it if she died by my command. May the Triad guide her steps.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Counsellor Florrick will be relieved to hear that you're all right.

407.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
407.text: While the Absolute commanded my mind, I condemned her to death and confined her in Wyrm's Rock Prison.

567.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
567.text: She stood by me even as the Hells' fires lapped at my feet. You must free her.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I'll go to Wyrm's Rock and take her to safety.

281.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
281.text: Thank you. I will be forever in your debt.

346.speaker: Player
346.text: I've talked to Florrick already. I'll get her out of that prison.

480.speaker: Player
480.text: I tried, but she refused to leave. She's lost all hope.

10.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
10.text: Then try again. Tell her I'm safe, tell her my mind is freed. I swear to you, she will listen.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: I wasn't planning on going that way, but I'll see what I can do.

577.speaker: Player
577.text: No. And I'm not about to.

183.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
183.text: You've done so much for me - I can't blame you for refusing. But I hope you'll reconsider.

341.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
341.text: Florrick's a great friend to me, and a great friend to the city. She'll make a stalwart ally for you.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: Florrick is gone, Ravengard. I thought you should know.

97.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
97.text: My own family was never so true. She deserved a better fate than death.

163.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
163.text: Dearest Florrick. May your journey to the Fugue Plane be a peaceful one.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: How did the Absolute cultists capture you?

268.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
268.text: I was returning from Elturel. My travelling party stopped at an inn - Waukeen's Rest - to lay our heads.

538.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
538.text: It wasn't the heat that woke me - it was the scent. Cultists had set fire to the place. I don't remember being taken, just the smoke burning my throat before I fell.

160.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
160.text: If only Florrick - oh hells, Florrick!

443.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
443.text: I awoke in Moonrise Towers, inside one of those damnable pods. The rest -

14.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
14.text: Well, the rest goes without saying.

569.speaker: Player
569.text: What was your business in Elturel?

262.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
262.text: I went to greet Elturel's High Overseer - only for the archdevil Zariel to drag the city into the Hells.

16.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
16.text: I, too, have been touched by Avernus, my boy. A tale for other places, other days.

31.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
31.text: I have been touched by Avernus, been a plaything for demons. A tale for other places, other days.

435.speaker: Player
435.text: What happens to Baldur's Gate when the Absolute falls?

250.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
250.text: Even before I was infected, the dukes and patriars applauded as Gortash took control.

220.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
220.text: They cheered as his automatons marched the streets, lauded his tyranny of steel in the interest of security.

420.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
420.text: I will rebuild the city. But first, I will tear down the Council and start anew.

376.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
376.text: Those who would give up the freedom of the people to purchase temporary safety deserve neither power nor liberty.

442.speaker: Player
442.text: I read 'The Legend of Ansur'. What do you make of it?

449.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
449.text: It's no legend. Ansur does sleep beneath the Rock and will come to the city's aid when it is in need. He is oathbound to do so.

445.speaker: Player
445.text: Balduran is still with us. He is the mind flayer that protects our minds from the Absolute.

402.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
402.text: Gods, can it be - the man who raised the city's walls became an illithid?

147.text: You both know you owe your lives to me. I am not fallen - I am risen.

185.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
185.text: We must make this a secret we carry beyond the grave. No name is more sacred to the city than Balduran's. Not even mine.

315.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
315.text: When the people think his name or see his likeness, they must imagine a hero, not a horror.

287.speaker: Player
287.text: That's a lot to ask. I'll do what I can, but I won't make promises I can't keep.

452.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
452.text: Your best is all you can offer. I'll ask for nothing more.

398.speaker: Player
398.text: I came here to save my own skin, not this godsforsaken city.

396.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
396.text: Fine. As long as you fell the Absolute. I will repair the cracks and craters you leave behind.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I don't save cities for free.

414.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
414.text: Of course. The city is wealthy. If you save us, I shall raise a tax in your name. And we shall erect a statue.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Refuse the Emperor and tell Ravengard to trust you.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: His hand flies to Ravengard's head, then he lowers it.

359.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
359.text: Sit in silence while those cultists enslave my city? I'd rather... ugh! My damned head.
359.context: CinematicNodeContext: His hand flies to Ravengard's head, then he lowers it.

308.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
308.text: *Sigh.* Who would I be to question my saviour? Thanks to you, I think my own thoughts and speak my own words.

364.speaker: Player
364.text: He's already suffering in Bane's hands. A shame, too - he might have been useful.
364.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I'll make sure he gets what's coming to him.
115.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

90.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
90.text: I am Ulder Ravengard! I will not stand by while... ngh...
90.context: NodeContext: Cutt off by a severe headache.

340.speaker: Player
340.text: I need Gortash alive. He could prove useful.
340.context: NodeContext: Cut off by a severe headache.

279.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
279.text: No more useful than the rotting corpse he'll... ngh...
279.context: NodeContext: Cut off by a severe headache.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: I'm sorry, Grand Duke, but you're in no condition to fight.
436.context: NodeContext: Cut off by a severe headache.

401.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
401.text: I am Ulder Ravengard! As long as I draw breath, I will cut down... ngh...
401.context: NodeContext: Cut off by a severe headache.
